text: {{Infobox writer | name = Richard Roeper | image = File:RichardRoeper06TIFF.jpg | caption = Richard Roeper in 2006 | birth_date = | birth_place = Chicago, Illinois, U.S. | occupation = Columnist | nationality = American | subject = Film criticism | alma_mater = Illinois State University | website = }} Richard Roeper (born October 17, 1959 in Chicago, Illinois) is an American movie critic, television personality, journalist, and historian. He starred on the American television program "At the Movies" with Roger Ebert from 2000 to 2008 as Gene Siskel's successor. Roeper also writes about movies for an American newspaper, the Chicago Sun-Times. ==References== ==Other websites== * * Biography from TV Tome * Category:1959 births Category:Living people Category:American journalists Category:American historians Category:Movie critics from Chicago Category:Writers from Chicago
